text: As a boy, Philip Barber was fined $25 for writing on the cover of a library book cover. The experience didn't deter him; henceforth he was careful in his selection of material, but remained inexortably drawn to book covers as a canvas.   Salvaged from second-hand shops, Barber adulterates and personalizes covers in a manner that both obscures and reacts to the original.
description: An open book (or diary) with writing on one page and drawing on the opposite page; on R panel (page): the rear end of a canoe superimposed against a background of messy writing, much of which has been crossed out or partially erased; the L panel (page) is a predominantly blue composition with moments of other colors; annotations and blue scribbling around margins
